title: Grade 12 - Entrepreneurship: Venture Planning in an Electronic Age BDV4C (2006)
subject: Business Studies

document.title: Grade 12 - Entrepreneurship: Venture Planning in an Electronic Age BDV4C (2006)

09C6AD9EF2D443A79CEEE454906FAD1B.description: assess, on the basis of the information in the venture plan, the potential for the viability of the venture.

2EC28EFB3594445B8AA17E4ADFC070E6.description: produce a final version of their venture plan, including their website, demonstrating the effective use of business communication techniques;

C101A3456F8048A2AE28B376ACF235AF.description: determine, on the basis of the feedback received, the revisions that should be made to their venture plan, including their website;

E5D62862901D46F5869DC18F7831976C.description: identify the individuals in their school and community who could assess and respond to their venture plan, including their website (e.g., peers, teachers,advisers, investors, bankers, relatives, community college/ university faculty, business mentors);

67E6EC7B233F40AA8BA462B122945ECD.description: Assessing and Revising the Plan, Including the Website: assess and finalize the venture plan, including the website, and use it to assess the viability of their venture

CEF55F14F51E4269B294FC77E7F7BCEE.description: create an effective website for their venture (e.g.,using OSAPAC software,MS Publisher, Dreamweaver).

8B24DF3F3AF64F84ADB9B7290FBBCCE0.description: develop the website elements and content (e.g., text, images, navigation bars, logo, heading, e-commerce payment systems, copyright information);

7E5B98B77E65429D8A1707180957081A.description: define the purpose and target audience for their venture website;

AFF37E860CA04B709BBD8E80DD61F2DE.description: Venture Website Design: design a website as part of their venture plan;

61D5163335C24491B585C71A01C2BBEB.description: generate a draft version of their venture plan, using appropriate software.

FF448A5F87F548F7B9B04FA176970F18.description: explain how different types of computer software can assist in venture planning (e.g., spreadsheet software to help prepare financial statements; chart wizard to help prepare graphs; website design software to facilitate the development of the website; word processing software to help prepare the text of the report and to create tables; desktop publishing software to help prepare advertisements);

45CE8CF6A41E47E89694F1795E8B9A72.description: compare models of venture-planning frameworks (e.g., models available from Canadian financial institutions, the Entrepreneurship Centre);

F96DA744E83042C38D21274C48633BD3.description: use information technology for a variety of business purposes in the production of the venture plan;

7E22EEF6FDB8451DBF6661FE2F5597E1.description: develop, using appropriate software, the production, marketing, human resources, management, and financial components of their venture plan;

B2A8025706AF4A57A0B4E7BF83B9AE15.description: Preparing the Venture Plan:  produce, using appropriate computer software, the elements of a venture plan, including a production plan, marketing plan, human resources plan, management plan, and financial plan that are most appropriate for their proposed venture;

41E02EFEFC7B42AAB1A4C4B8B0EE6707.description: analyse growth strategies (e.g., offering new products or services, developing new pricing policies, finding new channels of distribution) and expansion strategies (e.g., franchising, acquiring a competitor's business, establishing new branches) for their venture.

3286B504B90645EFB35A77BDDCACA1B0.description: develop an advertising strategy (e.g., using flyers, brochures, banner advertisements, websites, local radio and television advertisements, word of mouth, publicity) and a promotional strategy (e.g., using business cards, coupons) to help establish and maintain an identity for their venture;

33412CFB1A33472DB23066A15D564DDE.description: develop an initial promotional strategy to launch their venture (e.g., a plan for the grand opening, coupons, giveaways);

7C6290EA166C4D7A962048F204228F6A.description: Promotional Strategies:  develop effective promotional strategies for their venture.

2E0864FD8A8B44C0A8E31AFDF625AB64.description: analyse the impact of competition on their venture (e.g., on new opportunities, on future growth, on pricing policies).

DB5A3C4DD89947F5B48FE1E2915C2134.description: analyse strategies (e.g., pricing, promotion, distribution) for marketing the good or service that is the basis for their venture;

E613143013B64E58824ADED384C14764.description: describe, on the basis of research (e.g., survey, personal observation), the potential customers for their venture;

6AE5B2DE8F1B40A99B3E9DC86F165AF7.description: Market Analysis: analyse the size and composition of the potential market for their venture;

21BA3ECDD2474E2093990FF01A261666.description: develop an effective strategy for raising capital for their venture.

6AE97AF638844CE4A859E3BA1BA47E48.description: identify the advantages and disadvantages of various sources of capital for their venture (e.g., family, personal savings, bank loan, private equity, government grants);

A63048D8005042A2B2169A81101DB199.description: describe the moral and ethical issues that may arise when determining an acceptable level of profit for their venture;

2BD5E04D9CF14CD4A90294F311765547.description: identify and describe the financial statements required by their venture (e.g., income statement, balance sheet, cash-flow forecast);

D571FB6CF6AE4B1FA224EC82F12D3494.description: differentiate between the resources required by their venture that are categorized as fixed costs and those that are variable costs;

ADF4B600A9414559970B378C313A4122.description: estimate the amount of capital that would be required to launch their venture;

D8353FD332114C3BA36828CC2FF32FFB.description: Financing: determine the financial requirements and sources of financing for their venture.

7470744EBDCF49829F736B89ACC50934.description: identify the international, federal, and provincial legislation relating to e-commerce and describe what these laws involve

BF2455F6876F4C28874C700A21D109F1.description: compare the types and costs of insurance available for their venture;

D02496EE1B784719A7E1C5D903D89C7E.description: describe how they would obtain patent, copyright, and/or trademark protection;

5FC0384E4DFB48D3AECDA74E137DD179.description: identify municipal requirements regarding possible sites for their venture (e.g., local zoning regulations, licensing requirements, by-laws);

721D189102D64CADAD07BD2904EE4D88.description: determine the legal requirements and estimated costs of establishing the form of business ownership for their venture (e.g., sole proprietorship, partnership, corporation) and registering the business name;

546911986E6A485D90E1733205D60AF8.description: Legal Requirements: determine the legal requirements of their venture;

54750863E2104EC1B9ACF7A6D8709BDF.description: describe how computer software (e.g., accounting software, contact management software) could be used to maintain accurate business records for their venture

68AE3040BE8F4CF2AC142E39CECAF9A6.description: determine effective ways to manage their venture (e.g., complete an organizational chart, a production flow chart);

B7D62E8BFDCD43DE871AD5DF67187A09.description: describe the elements of a mission statement (e.g., business philosophy, vision, goals, objectives) and assess how they can affect the way a venture is managed;

46F9E22026524E01B89AC31BDC9E1142.description: Management Requirements for Their Ventur:  determine effective ways to manage their venture;

786B944C6D384F158369F4DA3CCB438E.description: specify the physical resources their venture would require (e.g., office or work space, equipment, machinery).

AE31541B2C5F444AA7D23606565F26B8.description: determine the human resources (e.g., level and skill of employees) and related supports (e.g., benefit plans, training programs) their venture would require;

3FD1B686C2984F8296C9062E2471A871.description: Human and Physical Resources:  determine the human and physical resources needed for their venture;

BABC2EA18A3D46F88A1E512EE89424BD.description: summarize the information gathered from primary and secondary sources.

348A27FE2CFB4C36BA857029EAF133B1.description: identify public and private secondary sources of useful information (e.g., the Yellow Pages, local business directories, government and industry statistical reports available on the Internet or in libraries);

341460BB71AB442DA3BEC9D8F48B8561.description: establish a network of contacts that can help provide them with the information required for their venture (e.g., local entrepreneurs, local Chamber of Commerce, Rotary Club, Zonta Club);

81DFB0661754447E8E732BF2891FF12B.description: Organizing Information for Their Venture: determine the human and physical resources needed for their venture;

F94A843F0D5D487BBF2F1A66DB6706BC.description: compare a number of business plans in terms of their content, thoroughness, clarity, organization, social responsibility, and utility

902EC9458D0545C19A2CC07B285C69B7.description: identify and describe the components of a venture plan;

E524A6AFDF7942729F947D068DAC2212.description: Venture Plan Components:  analyse the key components of a venture plan;

FA09F489BDB449C59A1E69F3A8CF7AB6.description: compare the various forms of business ownership (e.g., sole proprietorship, partnership, corporation, cooperative, franchise) and select the one most appropriate for their chosen opportunity and idea.

AD84E9EE04424B9B84D4612BE76EFC97.description: outline the importance of incorporating ethical practices and social responsibility in the operating of a venture;

2A1DE09194674065B6B9C7A0542C2973.description: compare the various types of ventures (e.g., e-tail compared with retail, offering a service compared with producing a good, selling retail compared with selling wholesale);

4AEF6539CCF1443C8720196A0830100F.description: Types of Ventures: analyse the factors that would influence the form and type of their venture.

DB1A4C2DF0904744ADC32B42A1FCBD30.description: collect and compile feedback on what others think of the idea (e.g., present their idea to the class and summarize the feedback received) and, using the feedback, evaluate the idea in terms of its feasibility (e.g., its merit compared with alternatives, its match with their own interests and experience).

8AFFB7E30F024C2AAEE8102590B4F0EA.description: list possible ideas with regard to the identified new venture opportunity and select one idea that has the greatest potential for success;

ADCC584CBB374FD28067A4BE9F5D6A8F.description: identify ways in which creative ideas can be generated (e.g., mind mapping, brainstorming) and describe the situations and conditions in which students tend to be most creative (e.g., when drawing or writing, in drama productions, when working as part of a team, when researching on the Internet);

587D963698C44685936BBCC9FBF9CFD0.description: Generating, Selecting, and Assessing Ideas: generate ideas that match their selected entrepreneurial opportunity and assess the idea that is most appropriate for a new venture;

12AD522FDCC0414B86E34E99B8D9DDDF.description: identify community problems, needs, or wants that could best be addressed by a not-for-profit venture, and explain why

D00932B2CDCF46B7BCD32BF4FA1BC871.description: analyse the opportunities for creating a new venture that are most suited to their particular entrepreneurial abilities and determine which opportunity is the most promising;

B9622DDCEDA747EFB8DBC67FA46EA97D.description: identify community problems, needs, or wants, and explain how selected problems, needs, or wants could be addressed;

31836C5B13824D25AEE8E8CFC6218F97.description: Identifying and Evaluating Entrepreneurial Opportunities:  identify and evaluate entrepreneurial opportunities in their community in order to select one well suited to their interests and capabilities;

F205C696689945FBADCA26420838B83A.description: analyse the conditions (e.g., competitive, regulatory, economic, social, technological) facing ventures starting up in various markets

DE1009554F5A4DBF889560903306F127.description: summarize the factors that contribute to the success or failure of a new venture (e.g., technological skills and equipment; adequacy of capitalization; management and risk-management skills; ability to adapt to changes in economic conditions; environmental issues; effects of globalization; government policies);

79F6C9F12B7B493A82DE811BFCE751B3.description: explain the stages in the life cycle of a business;

FE0E85928C434E09BD66259A3149FE52.description: Start-up Challenges and Opportunities: analyse the challenges and opportunities of the start-up phase of a business life cycle;

C3B6FA33B36F48F497AE4A03B2ECB3A2.description: evaluate websites of current small businesses in terms of their design features (e.g., usability, ease of navigation, continuity of pages, appropriateness for audience, speed of download, contact information, methods of payment).

94D66FED4F924680A62D9082313FEAE7.description: identify and describe the components of an effective website for a small business (e.g., home page, contact information, copyright, last updated date, links, search engine, menu);

8D192434750343A6864429AE12D283A2.description: identify factors to consider when designing or commissioning a design for an ebusiness website for a small business (e.g., designer's personal expertise; available software; design elements, such as attractiveness, ease of use, speed of download);

CB495B4FB82A4DD89C16B5CB6D84E796.description: Evaluating Website Design: evaluate elements of website design for a small business.

E904D1A999F741B7AAB8A7F42AD9DB35.description: evaluate the financial implications for a small business of doing business electronically (e.g., currency fluctuations, tariffs, shipping).

9617FE4D9A5845C5B141C769E9F42BA7.description: evaluate the ethical issues involved for small businesses that do business electronically (e.g., confidentiality, establishing credibility and integrity);

7DF9956E95EE47D1B19BF49DDE2FDFE0.description: identify the technical, security, and business risks involved with implementing e-commerce in a small business (e.g., viruses, hackers, credit card fraud);

A7059B1B18BE487992A5C751F5B6546F.description: explain how e-commerce affects small business (e.g., increased competition, different methods of payment, increased worldwide market);

C67108E08FF442C18C2EC764A10B874D.description: The Impact of E-Commerce: evaluate the impact of e-commerce on small business;

FCA7E88D8EFB4F4E968CB133D0D02352.description: identify opportunities in e-commerce for entrepreneurs (e.g., explore the Yellow Pages and identify businesses that are candidates for online commerce).

D46F6B8116F04B2A8419884710C259B4.description: analyse the challenges of and trends in e-commerce of significance to entrepreneurs (e.g., keeping up with the increase in online commercial activity; trends in Internet sales to consumers and types of goods and services purchased online by businesses);

68C899F7C8EC4DAC8DA0F29A0FBCB8E1.description: identify types of e-commerce used by entrepreneurs (e.g., business to business, business to consumer, consumer to consumer);

D9875D2674574759B6DCA97E052B2897.description: E-Commerce Challenges and Opportunities: analyse the challenges and opportunities of doing business on the Internet;
